p: Docetaxel is a second-generation of taxoid with greater anticancer potency than paclitaxel. Valicherla et al. [ 106] developed docetaxel-loaded SEDDSs containing TPGS1000 (droplet diameter: 160 to 180 nm), and evaluated oral absorption and therapeutic activity. The SEDDSs had a 25-fold increased cytotoxicity against breast cancer (MCF-7) cells relative to the free drug. The absolute bioavailability of SEDDSs in rats (22%) was higher than that of Taxotere ® (7%). The chylomicron flow blocking and tissue distribution indicated the importance of lymphatic transport of SEDDSs, and that this accounted for its greater tumor accumulation than Taxotere ®.
